text: is a former Japanese football player. ==Playing career== Ishizue was born in Itami on July 22, 1964. After graduating from Tokai University, he joined All Nippon Airways (later Yokohama Flügels) in 1987. His opportunity to play increased and he became a regular goalkeeper in 1989–90 season. However, from 1990–91 season, he could hardly play in the match behind newcomer Masanori Sanada. In 1992, although Sanada left the club, he could hardly play in the match behind Atsuhiko Mori. In 1993 season, the club won the champions Emperor's Cup their first major title. He played in the Final, this is his only one match in this season. In 1995, he moved to his local club Vissel Kobe in Japan Football League. He played as regular goalkeeper and the club was promoted to J1 League in 1997. In 1998, his opportunity to play decreased behind Nobuhiro Maeda and he retired end of 1998 season. ==Club statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! colspan=3 | Club performance ! colspan=2 | League ! colspan=2 | Cup ! colspan=2 | League Cup ! colspan=2 | Total |- !
